title: Heading Animation - Comprehensive Usage Examples
description: Animated headings with SVG highlights and rotating text effects for impactful hero sections

examples.name: Hero Underline Highlight (Style-1)
examples.description: Large hero heading with animated underline highlight drawing attention to key word
examples.visualDescription: Center-aligned H1 with 'Innovative' underlined by animated purple SVG stroke that draws from left to right in 2 seconds
examples.useCase: Hero sections, landing page headlines, about page intros
warnings: highLightStyle requires style: 'highlights' (not 'textAnim')
AnimationDur is in SECONDS for highlights (not milliseconds)
strokeWidth 1-5 recommended (too thick looks bulky)
Animated SVG highlights may not work in IE11

examples.name: Circle Highlight with Bold Colors
examples.description: Centered heading with circular highlight around key word for maximum impact
examples.visualDescription: Large 'Best' word circled by animated red SVG stroke, contrasting with dark gray surrounding text
examples.useCase: Feature highlights, product USPs, award mentions, key benefits
bestPractices: Use circle for single words (not phrases) - works best with 3-12 characters
Make animated text slightly larger than surrounding text (4-8px) for emphasis
Use contrasting colors (dark text + bright highlight) for readability
Animation duration 1-2 seconds is ideal (not too fast, not too slow)

examples.name: Rotating Service Headlines (Text Animation Style-1)
examples.description: Dynamic heading with rotating words showing multiple services/benefits with underline effect
examples.visualDescription: Left-aligned heading 'We help you' followed by rotating words (Grow, Succeed, Scale, Thrive) with purple underline that animates with each word change
examples.useCase: Agency homepages, multi-service businesses, SaaS features, product benefits

textAnimStyleOptions.style-1: Slide up with underline - Classic text rotation with underline that animates

warnings: durationTiming is in MILLISECONDS for textAnim (not seconds like highlights)
lineColor only works with textAnimStyle: 'style-1' (underline effect)
Each animText item needs unique _key for React rendering
Minimum 2 words required in animText array (otherwise no animation)

examples.name: Fade Text Animation (Style-2)
examples.description: Smooth fade transition between words for elegant, subtle effect
examples.visualDescription: Center-aligned heading with words fading in/out gracefully (Design, Develop, Deploy, Deliver) in teal color
examples.useCase: Professional services, portfolios, process descriptions, elegant brands

durationGuide.400-600ms: Fast - Dynamic, energetic feel (good for many words)
durationGuide.1200-1500ms: Slow - Thoughtful, dramatic (good for fewer words)
durationGuide.2000ms+: Very slow - May feel sluggish (avoid unless intentional)

examples.name: Slide Text Animation (Style-3)
examples.description: Words slide up vertically for dynamic, modern effect
examples.visualDescription: Words slide upward replacing each other (Build, Launch, Grow) with purple gradient animation
examples.useCase: Startups, tech companies, modern brands, action-oriented headlines
commonMistakes: Using too many words (5+) in animText makes animation feel endless
Setting durationTiming too short (<400ms) makes text unreadable
Forgetting postfixText when you need it (e.g., 'Build Your Startup')
Not testing on mobile where font sizes are smaller

examples.name: Flip Text Animation (Style-4)
examples.description: Words flip like cards for playful, attention-grabbing effect
examples.visualDescription: Words flip 3D-style (Websites, Apps, Experiences) in orange color with bold typography
examples.useCase: Creative agencies, portfolios, product showcases, playful brands
accessibilityConsiderations: Animated text should not contain critical information (users with motion sensitivity may have prefers-reduced-motion enabled)
Use titleTag semantically (h1 for main page heading, h2 for section headings)
Ensure sufficient color contrast ratio (WCAG 4.5:1 for body text, 3:1 for large text)
Avoid red/green combinations for colorblind users

examples.name: Multi-Word Curly Highlight
examples.description: Hand-drawn style curly underline for friendly, approachable brand voice
examples.visualDescription: Playful curly underline animates beneath 'Amazing' in bright green, creating hand-drawn sketch effect
examples.useCase: Creative brands, children's products, casual/friendly voice, organic products

highlightStyleRecommendations.highlight: Notes, tips, casual emphasis (like highlighter pen)

examples.name: Rapid Rotating CTA Benefits
examples.description: Fast-paced text rotation showing multiple benefits to create urgency
examples.visualDescription: Quick 600ms rotation through 6 benefits (Save Time, Save Money, Boost Sales, etc.) in red for urgency
examples.useCase: CTAs, limited-time offers, feature lists, benefit highlights, urgency creation
performanceConsiderations: Animated headings use CSS transitions/transforms (GPU-accelerated, performant)
SVG path animations use stroke-dashoffset technique (smooth 60fps)
Avoid using 10+ animated headings on one page (can cause layout thrashing)
Test on mobile devices (animations may perform differently)
Consider prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query for accessibility

validationRules.highlightsText: Required when style='highlights', the word to highlight
validationRules.animText: Required when style='textAnim', array with minimum 2 items, each needs unique _key
validationRules.durationTiming: For textAnim mode, in milliseconds (400-2000 recommended)
validationRules.AnimationDur: For highlights mode, in seconds (1-3 recommended)
validationRules.titleTag: Semantic HTML tag (h1/h2/h3/h4/h5/h6/div), use h1 for main heading only

warnings: CRITICAL: durationTiming uses MILLISECONDS for textAnim, AnimationDur uses SECONDS for highlights - don't confuse them!
Each animText item requires unique _key for React rendering (use '0', '1', '2', etc.)
highLightStyle requires style: 'highlights' to work (won't show with textAnim)
lineColor only works with textAnimStyle: 'style-1' (underline effect)
Minimum 2 words required in animText array for animation to work
animTypo and textTypo should have matching fontSize for consistent line height
SVG highlights (underline, circle, curly) may not work in IE11 - fallback to plain text
strokeWidth >5 can look bulky and overlap other elements
AnimationDur <0.5s may be too fast to see, >4s may feel sluggish
durationTiming <400ms makes text unreadable, >2000ms feels slow
Using 6+ words in animText makes endless loop feel tiresome
Don't nest animated headings inside other animated elements (conflicts)
prefixText/postfixText should grammatically connect with highlighted/animated word
Test all animation styles on mobile - some may not trigger on touch devices
Avoid using critical information in rotating text (users with prefers-reduced-motion won't see it animate)
commonMistakes: Using highlightsText when style='textAnim' (use animText array instead)
Using animText array when style='highlights' (use highlightsText instead)
Setting durationTiming in seconds instead of milliseconds (600 not 0.6)
Setting AnimationDur in milliseconds instead of seconds (2 not 2000)
Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 before applying typography settings
Not providing unique _key for each animText item (causes React warnings)
Using same font size for animTypo and textTypo when you want emphasis (make animated text slightly larger)
Setting alignment as string 'center' instead of object {md: 'center'}
Forgetting postfixText when it's grammatically necessary
Using too many words (10+) in rapid rotation (overwhelming)
Not testing responsive typography (text too large/small on mobile)
Using single-word animText array (minimum 2 required for animation)
Setting strokeColor without setting strokeWidth (invisible stroke)
Using lineColor with textAnimStyle other than style-1 (won't show)
Not considering color contrast for accessibility (animColor vs background)
Using uppercase textTransform on already capitalized text (redundant)
bestPractices: Use h1 for main page heading only (SEO), h2-h6 for section headings
Keep highlighted words short (3-12 characters) for best visual effect
Use 3-5 words in animText array for optimal pacing (not too short, not endless)
Set durationTiming based on word length: short words 600ms, long words 1000ms
Make animColor contrast with textColor for emphasis (e.g., purple animated word in gray text)
Use prefixText and postfixText to provide context (e.g., 'We help you [Grow] your business')
For highlights: AnimationDur 1.5-2s is sweet spot (visible but not slow)
For textAnim: durationTiming 800-1000ms is balanced (readable but dynamic)
Use semantic titleTag: h1 for hero, h2 for section headings, h3 for subsections
Responsive typography: reduce font size 25-30% on mobile (56px → 32px)
Use alignment based on context: center for hero, left for body content
Choose animation style based on brand: style-1 (underline) professional, style-4 (flip) playful
Use circle highlight for single important words (Best, New, Free, Award-winning)
Use curly highlight for friendly/organic brands (handmade, artisan, kids)
Keep strokeWidth 2-4 for most highlights (3 is default, good balance)
Test all breakpoints: desktop, tablet (sm), mobile (xs)
Consider loading performance: use 1-2 animated headings per page (not 10+)
Ensure WCAG color contrast: 4.5:1 for regular text, 3:1 for large (18px+) bold text
Use letter-spacing for uppercase text (1-2px) for readability
Match font families between textTypo and animTypo for consistency
Provide grammatically correct sentences with prefix + animated/highlighted word + postfix
For CTAs: use faster animations (600ms) with action verbs (Save, Grow, Win)
For hero sections: use slower, dramatic animations (1000ms+) with aspirational words
Group related words in animText (all verbs, all benefits, all features - don't mix)

solutions: Verify style is set to 'highlights' (not 'textAnim')
Check that highLightStyle is set (underline, circle, etc.)
Ensure strokeColor and strokeWidth are defined
Test in modern browser (SVG animations don't work in IE11)
Verify style is set to 'textAnim' (not 'highlights')
Check that animText array has minimum 2 items
Ensure each animText item has unique _key
Verify durationTiming is set (800-1000 recommended)

troubleshooting.issue: Underline not showing with style-1 text animation
solutions: Verify textAnimStyle is 'style-1' (lineColor only works with style-1)
Check that lineColor is defined (e.g., '#667eea')
Ensure style is 'textAnim' not 'highlights'
Verify openTypography is set to 1 (not 0)
Check that fontSize object has md/sm/xs properties
Ensure unit is specified ('px', 'rem', 'em')
Clear browser cache if using custom fonts

troubleshooting.issue: Animation feels too fast or too slow
solutions: For textAnim: adjust durationTiming in milliseconds (800-1000 recommended)
For highlights: adjust AnimationDur in seconds (1.5-2 recommended)
Test with different word lengths (longer words need more time)
Consider user expectations (CTAs can be faster, hero can be slower)

troubleshooting.issue: Highlighted word breaking to new line
solutions: Use white-space: nowrap on animated text (custom CSS)
Reduce font size on mobile breakpoints (xs)
Keep highlighted words short (3-12 characters ideal)
Test responsive layouts on actual devices
Verify color format is valid hex (#667eea) or rgba(102, 126, 234, 1)
Check that textColor and animColor are both defined
Ensure strokeColor matches animColor for cohesive look
Test color contrast for accessibility (WCAG 4.5:1 ratio)
Use object format for alignment: {md: 'center', sm: 'center', xs: 'left'}
Don't use string format: 'center' (won't be responsive)
Test all three breakpoints: md (desktop), sm (tablet), xs (mobile)
Consider center alignment on mobile for better balance

seoConsiderations: Use h1 for main page heading only (one per page)
Use h2-h6 for section hierarchy (don't skip levels)
Ensure highlighted/animated text contains important keywords
Provide meaningful text in prefixText + highlightsText/animText + postfixText for screen readers
Don't rely solely on animation to convey information (accessibility)
Use titleTag semantically based on page structure (not just visual preference)
Animated headings are indexed by search engines (text is in DOM, not images)
